sub_topic: Calculation of the ionization energy of atoms
message_1: Calculate the ionization energy of a hydrogen atom in its ground state, given that the energy required to ionize the atom is 13.6 eV.
message_2: The ionization energy of a hydrogen atom in its ground state is the energy required to remove an electron from the atom, which is equal to the negative of the energy of the electron in the ground state. In this case, the ionization energy is given as 13.6 eV. Therefore, the ionization energy of a hydrogen atom in its ground state is 13.6 eV.
